page.title: 09Braintree Parking Facilities
page.content: Braintree has at present a parking problem. Two main carparks are available, Blyths Meadow and Sandpit Lane, but are often full of motor vehicles and the problem is exagerated during busy shopping times. On Market days, Wednesdays and Saturdays, the problem becomes even more accute, due to both the increase in traffic and the stalls standing on the small parking bays scattered thoughout the town. During a survey carried out in the centre of Braintree pedestrians and shoppers alike expressed a wish for a multi-story carpark. Motorists often use the store carparks or those private ones with restricted access. Three stores in the town have their own carparks. These are designed for the use of the store patrons only.
